titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Burnett Bolloten Papers, 1923-1991
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rebecca J. Mead; machine-readable finding aid created by Xiuzhi Zhou

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-11-18T17:16-0800

change.item: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated, added photo file information
Revised to update encoding and add unitid
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Burnett Bolloten Papers)//EN" "reg_133.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.langmaterial: In Spanish, Catalan, French, English, Italian and Russian.

physdesc.extent: 117 manuscript boxes, 5 oversize boxes, 266 microfilm reels, 1 envelope, 2 phonotape reels, 5 phonotape cassettes

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, serial issues, clippings, other printed matter, and audiovisual materials, relating to political, military and international aspects of the Spanish Civil War. Includes clippings from the Spanish, French, Italian and British press arranged day-by-day, microfilm of Spanish and foreign periodical issues, and copies of papers of Luis Araquistain, relating to the war. Used as research material for the books by Burnett Bolloten, The Grand Camouflage (1961), The Spanish Revolution (1979), and The Spanish Civil War (1991).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Burnett Bolloten Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1946.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Author, The Spanish Civil War: Revolution and Counterrevolution (published posthumously)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, letters, and eulogies. Arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mimeographs and typescripts, dispatches, bibliography, notes, and correspondence. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Comments by Diego Abad de Santillan relating to Bolloten's research,
"Anarchists in Government: A Paradox of the Spanish Civil War, " n.d. (co-authored with George Esenwein). Typescript
"Reply to Professor Robert Skidolsky's Article in Encounter of " 1980 May 10. Typescript and correspondence with Melvin Lasky, 1981
The Spanish Civil War: Revolution and Counterrevolution, Mimeograph

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes writings and correspondence by others. Arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

Wolfe, Bertram, Includes correspondence with Freda Kirchwey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph, typescript, and printed copies of writings by Araquistain, correspondence, speeches and writings by others, reports, notes, archival guide, and clippings. Arranged by form.

note.p: Primarily photocopies of material located in the Spanish Archivo Historico Nacional

did.unittitle: General. Archival guide, printed excerpts, and clippings,
"Una Carta al Times," Relates to political goals of Spanish exiles, particularly in the Junta Espaiola de Liberacion, based in Mexico. Holograph
"Carta de Luis Araquistain al presidente de las Cortes Republicanas, Diego Martinez Barrio," Printed copy
El Comunismo y la Guerra de Espana, Photocopy of printed pamphlet
"Negrin Held Dupe of Soviet Russia," Printed copy
"?Que haria hoy Largo Caballero?" Printed copy
Report of speech by Juan Negrin, Typescript
Review? Relates to the role of the Soviet Union in Spain, Holograph
Review of Die Beziehungen Zwischen Deutschland und der Sowjetunion, 1939-1941, Holograph
Review of Traslado del oro espanol a Rusia, Holograph
Reviews of Freedom's Battle and The Last Optimist by Julio Alvarez del Vayo, Holograph
"Rusia y Espaia," El Socialista, Holograph outline and printed copy
"Russian Action in Spanish War Now Revealed," ? Printed copy
"Siglos de Historia en un Aio," Claridad, Printed copy
"Soviet Activity in Spain Shown," Printed copy
"Soviet Chief Sends Advice to Caballero," Printed copy
"Soviets Broke Caballero, Prieto to Grab Control of Loyalists, War Depts.," The New Leader, Printed copy
Statement, Relates to relocation of Spanish government from Madrid. Typescript
Statement on the May events in Barcelona, Typescript
General. Official dispatches from the Spanish Embassy in Paris,
Banque Commerciale pour L'Europe du Nord,
Irujo y Ollo, Manuel de, Includes letters by Julio Alvarez del Vayo and Indalecio Prieto
"Los sucesos de Barcelona y la embajada de Espaia en Paris," Holograph
Untitled fragment relating to Russian involvement in the Spanish Civil War, Holograph
Untitled writing relating to Juan Negrin, Holograph
Untitled writing relating to the role of Spanish communists in the Spanish Civil War, Holograph
Untitled writings on the origins of the Spanish Civil War, Holographs
"La Verdad Sobre el Comunismo en Espaia," Open letter to Norman Thomas. Typescripts
"What Stalin Did With Spain," Printed copy
"Why the Spanish Republic Fell: A Tragedy of Errors," Holograph
General. Typescript and printed copies of speeches and writings by Jay Allen, Sam Baron, Harry Gannes and another,

Consejo Nacional de Defensa. Communication to the Diputacion Permanente de las Cortes, typescript report by Trifo Gomez, and a typescript report relating to the coup entitled "Levantamiento comunista," ca. 1937-1939
Largo Caballero government, Formation of. Notes by Jose Aguirre,
Partido Socialista Obrero Espaiol. Letters between the executive committee and Jose Aguirre, Indalecio Prieto and others,
Toryho, Jacinto. "Destitucion Fulminante del Compaiero Jacinto Toryho de su Cargo de Director de Solidaridad Obrera," Typescript report by Toryho

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescripts, printed copies, notes, interviews, speeches, clippings; also includes material by others relating to these individuals. Arranged alphabetically by author.

Aigaude, Artemio. Typescript notes and interview,
Alvarez del Vayo, Julio. Printed writings, articles, speech, clippings, and interview,
Asensio, Jose. Printed writing, clippings, and typescript notes by Enrique Lumen,
Bates, Ralph. Printed writings, clippings, interview transcript, and notes,

Brandt, Willy. Printed copy of Krieg und Revolution in Spanien,
Carrillo, Santiago. Printed writings, interview excerpts, and speeches,
Carrillo, Wenceslao. Speech, printed excerpt, and notes,

Hidalgo de Cisneros, Ignacio and Constancia de la Mora. Shorthand interview notes, clipping, and printed writings by Hidalgo de Cisneros and de la Mora, SEE ALSO: SPEECHES AND WRITINGS/General/Dispatches

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by serial title and chronologically thereunder. See also: SCRAPBOOKS and MICROFILM

did.unittitle: Chronological. NOTE: Most of this material reflects a prior chronological arrangement which includes many of the same publications itemized subsequently

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, printed articles, printed excerpts, clippings, pamphlets, flyers, speeches, bulletins, newsletters, resolutions, conference proceedings, circulars, transcripts, notes, statutes and by-laws, bibliographies, biographical material, interview notes, lists, maps, and bound volumes of miscellaneous documents. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: General. Bound volumes of miscellaneous documents, SEE: Appendix A for itemized list
Biographical material and obituaries, Arranged alphabetically
Reports, Photocopies of material in the Rudolf Rocker Collection, International Institute of Social History, Amsterdam. SEE: Appendix B for itemized list

Agrarian issues. Includes material relating to agrarian collectives and the Unio de Rabassaires. Printed articles and excerpts, clippings, letters, report, by-laws, and typescript copies of Edward Malefakis, "The Agrarian Problem and the Republic," and Miguel Vidal, "El Campo Espaiol,"
General. Conference proceedings, clippings, printed excerpts, and bulletins,
General. Letters relating to the periodical Liberacion,
Consejo Obrero de Industrias Metalurgicas Socializadas. Letters and reports,
Consejo Obrero de la Industria de Calzado y Similares. Letters and reports,
Partido Comunista de Espaia. Reports and correspondence between local and provincial committees,
Almeria incident, Pamphlet, and printed article and excerpts, ca. 1937-1977

Amigos de Durruti. Pamphlet, flyers, clippings, printed excerpts, notes, chronology, and a typescript copy of "Historia de la 'Agrupacion Amigos de Durruti," (incomplete) SEE ALSO: CORRESPONDENCE FILE/Balius, Jaime
Andrade Rodriguez, Juan. Typescript copy of George Esenwein, "Juan Andrade Rodriguez " n.d.
General. Includes material related to the Falange Espaiola and to the death of Jose Calvo Sotelo. Printed excerpts and printed articles by Diego Abad de Santillan, Lawrence A. Fernsworth and others,
Asturias, 1934 uprising. Clippings and printed articles by Harry Gannes and another,
Antonov-Ovseenko, Vladimir. Biographical sketch, notes, and printed articles by Jaume Miravitlles and another,

Aragon. Clippings, printed excerpts, notes, typescript meeting transcript, and a typescript copy of Jose Duque, "La Situacion de Aragon al Comienzo de la Guerra," SEE ALSO: Military organization and operations
Azaia, Manuel. Speeches and writings by Azaia, printed articles and excerpts, notes, and clippings,
Barcelona, Events of SEE ALSO: CLIPPINGS/ General/Chronological/1937 May

Non-printed matter. Notes, statement, transcripts of communications between Manuel Azaia and Indalecio Prieto, and reports by Jaime Aiguade, Jordi Arquer, Luis Companys, Hugo Oehler, David Wingate Pike and others
Printed matter. Clippings, and printed articles and excerpts by Claude Bowers, H. N. Brailsford, Lawrence Fernsworth, Agustin Souchy, Bertram Wolfe and others,
Berneri, Camillo. Printed writings by Berneri, clippings, and printed articles by Giovanna Berneri, Maria Luisa Berneri, Max Soutin and others,

Besteiro, Julian. Clippings, letter, notes, and printed articles and excerpts by F. Ferrandiz Alborz, Jesus Hernandez, Salvador de Madariaga, Gabriel Moron and others, SEE ALSO: Final events, 1939 March
Casares Quiroga, Santiago. Typescript biography by Alfonso Quintana y Peia,

Catalonia. Primarily relates to politics and government. Statutes, clippings, printed articles and excerpts by Manuel Benavides, Allison Peers, Angel Ossorio, Carles Pi Sunyer and others, untitled typescript by Ricardo del Rio relating to the last days of the war in Catalonia, and a typescript copy of Gabriel Jackson, "Autonomous Catalonia and the Spanish Republic"

Non-printed matter. Circulars, bulletins, notes, and typescript copies of "Work and Revolution: Workers' Control in Barcelona in the Spanish Civil War, " John Amsden, "Industrial Collectivisation Under Workers' Control: Catalonia, 1936-1939," and Miguel Jimenez, "Problemas de la Revolucion Espaiola," and a mimeograph copy of Gabriel Jackson, "The Living Experience of the Spanish Civil War Collectives," 1936-1969
Printed matter. By-laws, clippings, and printed articles and excerpts by Gaston Leval, J. Oltra Pico, Jacinto Toryho and others,

Comite Central de Milicias Antifascistas de Catalunya. Clippings, printed excerpts by Juan Garcia Oliver, Josep Tarradellas, Jacinto Toryho and others, statement by Buenaventura Durruti, and a typescript copy of George Esenwein, "Central Antifascist Militias Committee,"

Communist International (Comintern). Clippings, letter, biographical sketches, printed articles by Benjamin Gitlow, Arthur Koestler, J. Martinez Amutio and others, and a typescript memoir by Herbert Matthews, SEE ALSO: Soviet Union
Companys, Luis. Speeches by Companys and Indalecio Prieto, clippings, and printed excerpts and articles by Diego Abad de Santillan, Angel Ossorio and others,
Confederacion Nacional del Trabajo (CNT)-Federacion Anarquista Iberica (FAI). SEE ALSO: Federacion Anarquista Iberica (FAI)

General. Archival guide to material in the International Institute of Social History, bulletin, press reports, and a typescript copy of George Esenwein, "Anarchism During the Second Republic: The Emergence of a Mass Movement,"
Printed matter. Clippings, circular, by-laws, conference proceedings, reports, and printed excerpts and articles by Jose Garcia Pradas, Jacinto Toryho and others,
Consejo Economico Confederal. Circulars, reports, chart, and clippings,
Constitution. Printed excerpts and printed copy of the Spanish constitution,
Durruti, Buenaventura. Speech by Durruti, clippings, notes, and printed excerpts and articles by Diego Abad de Santillan, Emma Goldman and others, SEE ALSO: MICROFILM/Reel 259
Economics and finance. Speech by Mariano Cardona Rossell, clippings, reports, notes, and printed excerpts,
Espionage and sabotage. Telegram and printed articles,

Euzkadi (Spain). Relates to Basque nationalism and the war in the north. Clippings, printed excerpts and articles, pamphlet by Manuel Chiapuso, Generalidades sobre Euzkadi y la C.N.T., typescript report by Jose Antonio Aguirre, and a typescript copy of Manuel de Irujo, "La Guerra Civil en Euzkadi antes del Estatuto," SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Euzkadi
Federacion Anarquista Iberica (FAI). Printed interview, excerpts, and articles, conference report, speech, and notes,
Final events, Includes material relating to the Casado coup and the conspiracy at the Cartagena naval base
Non-printed matter. Bulletins, letters by Jose Estrugo, Juan Negrin and Ramon Lamoneda, and typescript and mimeograph reports, including F. Ferrandiz Alborz, "Llego la Bestia,"

Printed matter. Speeches by Julian Besteiro and Segismundo Casado, printed articles and excerpts by Pedro Checa, Lawrence Fernsworth, Ignacio Hidalgo de Cisneros, Herbert Matthews, Jose Garcia Pradas, Georges Soria, Cipriano de Rivas Cherif and others,
Foreign relations and foreign public opinion. SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/World politics,

General. Telegrams, printed articles and excerpts, typescript copy of Sally V. McBean, "Spain's Courtship of the West," and mimeograph copies of John Jagger and Wilfrid Roberts, "The Anglo-Italian Agreement and 'Settlement' in Spain," and Rudolf de Jong, "The Netherlands and the Spanish Civil War,"
France. Printed articles and excerpts, telegram, clipping, and printed diplomatic correspondence,
Germany. Printed articles and excerpts, printed copies and photocopies of diplomatic correspondence and other documents, letter, and clippings,
Great Britain. Printed articles and excerpts, telegram, and photocopies of British Cabinet documents,
Italy. Printed article, bibliography, and printed copies of diplomatic documents,
Latin America. Telegrams, typescript book review, and printed article and excerpts,
United States. Printed articles and excerpts, telegram, newsletters, and printed diplomatic correspondence,
Fourth International. Bulletins, clippings ( La Voz Leninista), circular, and reports, including a report by Manuel Grandizo Munis to Leon Trotsky, SEE ALSO: Trotsky, Leon
Franco, Francisco. Speech by Franco, poems, clippings, and printed articles and excerpts, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Spain (Franco regime)
Gero, Erno. Clippings and printed excerpts, SEE ALSO: Antonov-Ovseenko, Vladimir

Gold. Primarily relates to the transfer of gold to the Soviet Union in 1936. Bulletin, correspondence with the British Museum, and printed excerpts and articles by Alexander Orlov, Angel Viias and others,
Guernica. Printed articles, excerpts, and clippings,
Hemingway, Ernest. Clippings, printed articles and excerpts, and printed writing by Hemingway, SEE ALSO: SPEECHES AND WRITINGS BY OTHERS/Marty, Andre

General. Printed articles, notes, clippings, bibliography, and mimeograph copies of David W. Pike, "The Spanish Civil War: A New Perspective," and Stephen Schwartz, "The Spanish Civil War: Fifty Years After,"
Boletin de Orientacion Bibliografica. Serial issues,
Industry. Includes material relating to defense production. Printed excerpts and articles, clippings, circular, letters, notes, and bulletins,

International brigades. Printed articles and excerpts by Alvah Bessie, Luigi Longo (Gallo), John McNair, Gustav Regler, Carlo Rosselli and others, pamphlet, newsletters ( Volunteer for Liberty), reports, correspondence, and a mimeograph copy of Verle B. Johnston, "The International Brigades in the Spanish Civil War, " with additional comments by Johnston
Journalism and the war. Clippings, printed articles, and excerpts by Claud Cockburn, Malcolm Cowley, Martha Gellhorn, Joaquin Maurin and others,
Justice, public order, and human rights. Clippings, telegram, report, notes, and printed articles and excerpts,
Juventudes Socialistas Unificadas (JSU). Speech, conference reports, position papers, clippings (primarily Ahora), and printed excerpts,
Kleber, Emil. Printed excerpts, and typescript notes of interviews with Claud Cockburn, Irene Hudson and others,
Krivitsky, Walter G. Printed articles and excerpts by Krivitsky and others, poem, and a mimeograph copy of John Amsden, "Krivitsky,"
Kuznetsov, Nicolai. Notes, clippings, biographical sketch, and printed excerpt by Kuznetsov,

Literature and the war. Includes material relating to Federico Garcia Lorca, Benjamin Peret, Miguel de Unamuno and others. Pamphlet entitled Escritores asesinados por los rojos, mimeograph bulletin, clippings, and printed excerpts and articles by Lillian Hellman, John Sommerfield and others,
Llopis, Rodolfo. Correspondence, printed article, and writing by Llopis,
Madrid, Defense of. Newletters ( Milicia Popular), clippings, and printed excerpts and articles by Enrique Lister and others, SEE ALSO: Miaja, Jose
Malraux, Andre. Clippings, printed article, and a typescript copy of Bertram Wolfe, "The Autobiography of a Culture Hero,"
Miaja, Jose. Minutes of the Madrid Defense Junta and communications between Miaja and the central government, letter, printed articles and excerpts, shorthand interview notes, and typescript notes,

Non-printed matter. Letters to Carlos Contreras (Vittorio Vidali) by Santiago Alvarez, Enrique Lister, and others, interviews by Enrique Lumen, Arturo Perucho, Francisco Giner de los Rios, Pedro Martinez Carton, and Daniel Tapia, bulletins, circulars, press release, reports, notes, lists, and typescript copies of "Peripecies d'un Alferes de l'Exercit de Catalunya," Santiago Alvarez, "Experiencias del Trabajo Practico de un Comisario," Alberto F. Ballesteros, "Lo Occurido en Malaga," and Enrique Castro, "Las Tareas de los Comisarios en la Fase Actual de la Guerra,"
Printed matter. Circulars, bulletins, clippings, and printed excerpts and articles,
Popular militias. Includes material relating to groups which were reorganized as units in the regular army. SEE ALSO: Comite Central de Milicias Antifascistas de Catalunya
General. Clippings, printed excerpts, notes, and resolutions,
Fifth Regiment. Printed excerpts and notes relating to Enrique Castro,
Iron Column. Notes, printed excerpt, and newsletters ( Linea de Fuego),
Twenty-Eighth Division. Clippings and official bulletins,
Morocco, Spanish. Printed articles and excerpts,

NKVD (Narodnyi kommissariat vnutrennykh del). Pamphlets by Katia Landau, Le Stalinisme en Espagne, and John McGovern, Terror in Spain, printed excerpts, clippings, flyer, biographical sketch of Leonid Eitingon, and a typescript copy of Charles A. Orr, "Some Facts on the Persecution of Foreign Revolutionaries in 'Republican' Spain," SEE ALSO: Soviet Union

Nationalists and Falangists. Clippings, printed excerpts and articles, bulletin, and a typescript copy of Luis S. Ponce de Leon, "Las Primeras Semanas de la Guerra Civil Espaiola en los Periodicos Nacionalistas,"
Navy and naval operations. Printed articles and excerpts, telegram, and notes, SEE ALSO: Final Events
Negrin, Juan. Speeches by Negrin, notes, clippings, printed article and excerpts,

Nin, Andres. Printed excerpts and articles, clippings, pamphlet, press release, and typescript copies of Julio Antonio Maurin, "The Assassination of Andres Nin," George Esenwein, "Andreu Nin, " and Stephen Schwartz, "To the Memory of Andreu Nin," 1937-1985
Orlov, Alexander. Letters and writings by Bertram Wolfe, report, and printed articles and excerpts by Ignacio Iglesias, Jaume Miravitlles and another,

Partido Comunista de Espaia (PCE). Speeches, printed excerpts and articles by Juan Andrade, Pedro Checa and others, clippings, circular, program statement, meeting and conference reports, notes, and a typescript copy of "Por Que y Como Salimos de Espaia los Guerrilleros y el S.I.E.P.," by Valentin Gonzalez and others, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Partido Comunista de Espaia

General. Reports, position statements, telegrams sent to General Miaja protesting the dissolution of the POUM, notes, and typescript copies of Wilebaldo Solano, "Notas sobre el POUM en la Revolucion de 1936," and "La Revolucion Espaiola y el POUM,"
Independent News. Relates to the suppression of the POUM and the trials of its leaders

Printed matter. Flyer, resolutions, pamphlets, printed articles, excerpts, and clippings by Jose Bergamin, Fenner Brockway, Harry Gannes, Julian Gorkin, Mikhail Koltzov, John McNair, Victor Serge, Georges Soria and others,
Partido Socialista Obrero Espaiol (PSOE). Printed excerpts, clippings, and circular, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Partido Socialista Obrero Espaiol
Partit Socialista Unificat de Catalunya (PSUC). Conference reports, speech, printed excerpts, clippings, and notes, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Partit Socialista Unificat de Catalunya

Non-printed matter. Telegrams, bulletins, chart, notes, and typescript copies of "El P.C. y la Unidad Antifascista" (incomplete), and Edward Malefakis "Internal Political Problems and Loyalties: The Republican Side in the Spanish Civil War,"

Printed matter. Clippings, bulletins, minutes, serial issues, pamphlet, and printed excerpts and articles by Franz Borkenau, Claude Bowers, Lawrence Fernsworth, Louis Fischer, Jose Maria Gil Robles, John Langdon-Davies, Jesus Perez Salas, Carles Pi Sunyer and others
Primo de Rivera, Jose Antonio. Clippings, printed article, and notes,
Religion. Clippings, printed excerpts and articles, serial issue, and notes,
Saborit, Andres. Clippings and printed interview,
Servicio de Investigacion Militar. Includes material relating to Gustavo Duran and Jose Muioz Lopez. Notes, and printed articles and excerpts,

Soviet Union. Printed biographical sketches, notes, clippings, printed excerpts and articles, letters, printed diplomatic correspondence, a pamphlet entitled Soviet Russia and Spain, and a typescript dissertation excerpt by David E. Allen Jr., "The Soviet Union and the Spanish Civil War: " SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Soviet Union
Thirteen Points. Printed excerpts and articles,
Togliatti, Palmiro. Clippings and printed excerpts,

Trotsky, Leon. Includes material relating to Kurt Landau and Ramon Mercader. Printed interview and writings by Trotsky, letter by Katia Landau, clippings, and printed articles by Earl Browder, Will Herberg, Isaac Don Levine and others,
Union General de Trabajadores (UGT). Conference reports, speeches, clippings, and printed excerpts and interviews by Amaro del Rosal, SEE ALSO: SUBJECT FILE/Union General de Trabajadores
Uprising, Clippings, pamphlet, and printed excerpts and articles, 1936-1976
Vazquez, Mariano R. Speech by Vazquez, printed interview, clippings, notes, and printed writings by Jesus Hernandez, Andre Marty, and Federica Montseny,
Vidali, Vittorio (Carlos Contreras). Memorandum and report excerpt by Vidali, typescript interview notes, printed articles and excerpts, and a letter,
Youth. Clippings (primarily Juventud Libre), flyer, printed articles, and a letter and typescript by Wilebaldo Solano, "La Juventud Comunista Iberica en la Revolucion y la Guerra de Espaia,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reports, correspondence, printed articles, printed excerpts, clippings, flyers, speeches, bulletins, pamphlets, transcripts, notes, press releases and biographical material. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Euzkadi (Spain). Bulletin, printed article, and statement by Ramon Ormazabal,
Latin America. Clippings, testimony transcript, and printed excerpts,
Partido Comunista de Espaia (PCE). Clippings, pamphlet, printed excerpts and articles by Santiago Carrillo, Enrique Lister and others, and a typescript book review by George Esenwein,
Partido Socialista Obrero Espaiol (PSOE). Clippings, pamphlets, printed excerpts, and speeches and writings by Ramon Lamoneda, Rodolfo Llopis, Juan Negrin, Indalecio Prieto and others,
Partit Socialista Unificat de Catalunya (PSUC). Clippings, printed article, and letters by Juan Comorera,
Soviet Union. Biographical sketches, notes, letter, and printed articles and excerpts

Spain. Primarily relates to the Franco regime. Clippings, notes, debate transcript, bulletins, printed articles and excerpts, typescript book reviews by Bertram Wolfe and Luis S. Ponce de Leon, and a mimeograph copy of Adolfo Monsanto, "Panorama Politico de la Espaia Contemporanea,"

General. Typescript refugee reports, clippings, typescript copies of correspondence between Indalecio Prieto and Juan Negrin, printed articles and excerpts by Angel Ossorio, Jose Diaz and others, letters by Jay Allen, and a mimeograph copy of "Memorandum on the Attempt to Present Certain Antifascist Refugees as 'the Leaders of the Fifth Column in Latin America,'"
Relief organizations. Bound flyers, bulletins, leaflets, circulars, press releases, and pamphlets,
Republican government in exile. Printed articles, excerpts, and clippings,
Union General de Trabajadores. Clippings and printed excerpts,
World politics, Primarily relates to the events leading to World War II
General. Printed articles and excerpts by Winston Churchill, Anthony Eden and others
France. Printed copies of diplomatic messages,
Germany. Printed copies of diplomatic reports and messages,

Great Britain. Printed copies of diplomatic reports, messages, and parliamentary debates, typescript reports of cabinet meetings, a typescript memorandum by M. Hankey, "The Future of the League of Nations," and a typescript report of a statement by Maxim Litvinov with comments and a draft reply,
Soviet Union. Speeches by Maxim Litvinov and Vyacheslav Molotov,
World politics, Clippings, printed excerpt, and partial printed transcript of the Nuremberg trials, 1946-1975
World War, Primarily relates to Spanish involvement in the war. Printed articles and excerpts, 1966-1986
Yugoslavia. Bulletins, clippings, and printed articles and excerpts,

scopecontent.p: Clippings, serial issues, and typescript memorandum. Arranged alphabetically by serial title.

Burnett Bolloten interviewed by Ronald Hilton, sound recording

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bolloten gives a biography of his life, though with a focus and concentration on his time in Spain.
A second copy of this recording exists on two cassettes.

did.unittitle: KPFK FM Los Angeles broadcast program hosted by Suzi Weissman, sound recording

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Suzi Weissman and Jon Amsden interview Burnett Bolloten and Mark Sharron.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 8 prints of soldiers and civilians in Spain, circa 1936-1939; 2 prints (1 duplicate) and 1 negative of a British political cartoon, circa 1936-1949; 1 print of members of the Fifth Regiment, 1946?; 1 print of Ludwig Renn; 2 prints of previous hit Burnett Bolloten, 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
